column1: 1100 block of Morraine View Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Officers were sent to a disturbance at an apartment complex. Property Management had denied giving a key to a person asking to get into a relative’s apartment to take care of a dog. The subject began yelling and was told to leave the property.

Officers, concerned for the dog, began reviewing cameras and saw that no one had been in the apartment for numerous days. Property Management entered the apartment and requested police assist after locating a very small dog in very poor condition.

The dog did not have food or water and the apartment was over 83 degrees. Animal Control came and took the dog.

The owner, a 48 year old woman, was not on scene and has numerous pending charges including abandoning an animal and intentionally failing to provide food and water.

column1: 1000 block Williamson St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Man jumps from a balcony in an attempt to flee police.
 
Monday morning Madison officers responded to the 1000 block of Williamson Street to arrest a man. As officers arrive and attempt contact, the man jumps from a second story balcony and leads police on a short foot pursuit.
 
Officers are able to apprehend the subject who is taken into custody and transported to the Dane County Jail.
 
Justin Beasley, 40, arrested on several warrants, resisting, and possession of drug paraphernalia.

column1: 500 block State St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Multiple concerned citizens called in Monday evening to report a person threatening to hit people and acting “crazy”.
 
Officers arrived on scene and make contact with a subject who then resists their attempts to arrest him. The subject was stabilized, medically cleared at a local hospital and transported to the Dane County Jail.
 
Adam Hirssig, 34, arrested on charges of domestic disorderly conduct, criminal damage to property, theft and an additional charge of resisting.

column1: 2500 block Fich Hatchery Rd Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Loitering turned into an arrest after a subject is found to be in possession of methamphetamine 

Madison officers responded to the 2500 block of Fitch Hatchery Road for a loitering complaint around 8:30 p.m. During their contact with the subject he was found to be in possession of methamphetamine and the subject later admitting to ingesting more prior to officers arriving.

The subject was left at the care of hospital staff for observation with a felony order in citation.

column1: W Wilson Street Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating two disturbances, that occured at the same address, within 90 minutes of each other.

Officers were initially dispatched to a multi-unit property along the 500 block of E. Johnson St. around 11:10 p.m. on Thursday.

Officers arrived to find an apartment door had been kicked-in and damaged. A 69-year-old man was punched multiple times and had visible injuries.

A vape pen was stolen from his apartment.

The suspect was not inside the building when officers arrived.

At 12:17 a.m. on Friday, officers were dispatched to the same building. 

Officers arrived to find a large, exterior window had been shattered. 

Another person was found inside with visible injuries.

Officers followed a blood trail outside of the building and also located several identificaiton items along this trail.

Through more investigative work, probable cause was developed to arrest Latroy D. Castle, 32, for these burglaries.

Castle was found sleeping in the entryway of the City-County Building early Monday morning. He was arrested and taken to the Dane County Jail, where he began to fight and spit on deputies.

Castle was booked on battery and criminal damage to property charges, as well as new ones to include, resisting arrest, discharging bodily fluid at a public worker and bail jumping.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 1500 block Troy Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman pointed a gun at a neighbor during an argument.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 1500 block of Troy Dr. around 2:20 p.m. on Friday.
 
The woman is a concealed carry permit holder.
 
Qhivetta L. Harris, 42, of Madison was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed.
 
The firearm was recovered.

column1: S. Park St. at Buick St. Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man ran to a nearby family member’s house following a crash on the city’s south side Friday afternoon.
 
A vehicle was t-boned by another vehicle in the area of S. Park St. at Buick St. around 3:40 p.m.
 
Three senior citizens suffered minor injuries but were not taken to the hospital.
 
The suspect driver left the scene. Drugs and drug paraphernalia were found inside his vehicle. He was taken into custody at a nearby apartment building.
 
Shawn L. Jones, 26, of Madison, was arrested for hit-and-run, possession of cocaine, possession of drug paraphernalia and a probation hold.
 
He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

column1: Loomis Circle Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was arrested for his 3rd OWI after fleeing from a traffic stop Friday evening.
 
An officer noticed the man driving at a high rate of speed and passing in a no passing zone. The officer initiated a traffic stop, but the vehicle continued to Loomis Circle.
 
The driver resisted arrested and tried fighting with officers but was successfully taken into custody.
 
Gustavo Perreztorrez, 37, of Madison, was arrested for 3rd-offense OWI, resisting arrest, fleeing, and operating with a revoked license.
 
He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

column1: Thierer Rd. at E. Washington Ave. Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A woman, found to be driving a stolen vehicle, kicked at officers as they took her into custody on Friday.
 
The vehicle was reported stolen out of Middleton. It was tracked down Friday afternoon to a shopping area along the 1700 block of Thierer Road.
 
Officers conducted a high-risk traffic stop. The woman was the driver and the only person inside the vehicle.
 
She kicked at officers when they went to detain her. No officers were injured.
 
As this was happening, a crowd began to form. Officers spent time talking with the crowd to inform them what was happening.
 
A folding knife was found on the woman.

Khariyhana D. Martin, 24, of Madison, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent, batter ty law enforcement, carrying a concealed weapon, felony bail jumping and for a warrant out of Columbia County.

She was taken to the Dane County Jail.

column1: 4000 International Ln Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Officers received information that a wanted person was at the Dane County Airport potentially attempting to leave the state.  

When officers arrived and began looking in the airport, the person left in their vehicle. Dane County Sheriff’s Office found the vehicle a short distance away and tried to pull it over, but the driver sped away. The driver then crashed the vehicle and ran into a nearby home that was not his. The home was not occupied at the time.

Officers, including a K9, surrounded the house and were attempting to get the person to voluntarily exit the home. He refused and officers, including a K9 unit, entered to find him hiding under a pile of clothing. 

Jeffrey Clement, age 34, was arrested on multiple warrants and charges.

column1: 2325 Gene Parks Place Madison Wisconsin
column8:
MPD officers were dispatched to a citizen call of shots fired near Gene Parks Place and Mike McKinney Court.  Officers arrive in the area and find bullet casings in the street.  They began to process the scene and conduct witness interviews.  A short time later, a 23 year-old man arrived at a local hospital with non-life-threatening gunshot wounds.  Detectives with the Violent Crime Unit responded to the scene and hospital to complete interviews and collect evidence.  They continue to investigate this case.  The suspect or suspects remain at large.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

column1: 4300 Lien Road Madison Wisconsin
column8: Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the Target parking lot at 4301 Lien Road for a report of a man in medical distress at approximately 8:40pm.  Upon arrival, officers discovered that he had been stabbed multiple times in his torso area.  The victim was treated at the scene by citizens, police officers, and MFD.  The man was transported to a local hospital for treatment for significant injuries from this attack.  Detectives and officers collected evidence at the scene and released it around 10pm.  Through interviews, video, and scene-processing, it was learned that the victim’s vehicle was stolen during this incident.  Information was disseminated to Law Enforcement agencies state-wide, and the Racine County Sheriff’s Office located the vehicle in their jurisdiction.  RCSO and Wisconsin State Patrol were able to take a suspect into custody and recover the victim’s vehicle.  MPD Detectives and officers are continuing to work on the case at this time.  An update will be forthcoming when additional information is available.

column1: W Dayton Street Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A hotel employee was punched in the face while trying to help an intoxicated guest get safely back to her room.

Officers were dispatched to the Madison Concourse Hotel on W. Dayton St. around 1:30 a.m. on Monday.

The guest was taken to the hospital before being transported to the Dane County Jail.

Sarah N. Neindorf, 27, of Madison, was arrested for battery, disorderly conduct and resisting arrest.

column1: 700 block Pflaum Rd Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A teenager was arrested for beating a student at La Follette High School.

Officers were dispatched to the 700 block of Pflaum Rd. shortly before 2 p.m.

The victim was sitting at a desk waiting for class to start when she was attacked. She suffered visible injuries.

A teacher broke up the fight and suffered a minor injury during the process.

The 15-year-old female was contacted at a home on the north side and taken into custody. She was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center for battery.

column1: 2200 block of Van Hise Ave Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after a group of students agreed to fight each other off the West High School campus.

Officers were dispatched to the 2200 block of Van Hise Ave. around 3:45 p.m. on Thursday.

During the incident, one student suffered a superficial stab wound. He was found off campus and brought back to the school for medical care.

Officers contacted the suspect at his home.

The 15-year-old male was arrested for simple battery and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

This incident remains under investigaiton.

column1: 89 East Towne Way Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Strangers called for help after seeing a caregiver hit an elderly client outside of East Towne Mall.

Officers were called to the mall shortly before 7 p.m. on Tuesday.

After talking to the witnesses, officers contacted the suspect.

John R. Pfeiffer, 52, of Madison was arrested for physical abuse of an elder person.

column1: 2800 block E Washington Ave Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was arrested Saturday afternoon for attacking an elderly person earlier in the day.

Around 9:15 a.m., officers were dispatched to the area of Wisconsin Ave. and W. Mifflin Street for a battery.

A man told officers he was on he walking to a nearby pharmacy when a stranger began hitting and kicking him, continuing to do so even after he fell down.
 
A witness yelled at the suspect to stop and provided officers with his description. Officers also reviewed and noticed the suspect on city cameras.

Around 3:30 p.m., an officer noticed the suspect along the 2800 block of E. Washington Ave. at the East Towne Shopping Center.

The suspect refused to talk to the officer. He also attempted to fight officers taking him into custody.

As this was happening, a crowd formed, and officers had to also try to keep people from interfering with the arrest.

Joshua J. Berkahn, 36, of Madison, was arrested for battery to an elderly person and resisting arrest.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail after he was medically cleared.

column1: 300 block N Frances St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Staff and a patron at Ian's Pizza were assaulted after asking a subject to leave early Sunday morning.
 
Madison Police Officers responded to Ian's Pizza downtown after being called by staff who reported a subject refused to leave then assaulted a patron and their staff.
 
While on scene the subject re-entered the restaurant and was able to be taken into custody. 
 
Minor injuries reported by victims.
 
Louis Miranda, 30, arrested for 3 counts of battery, disorderly conduct, resisting and trespassing.

column1: 1800 block Loftsgordon Ave Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery that occurred on the city's north side late Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 1800 block of Loftsgordon Ave. around 11:45 p.m.

A 30-year-old man was upset and hitting the building. Another man exited the building and swung a scooter toward the 30-year-old. The 30-year-old was injured during this incident and taken to the hospital.

The other person involved was not at the scene when police arrived.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

This incident remains under investigation.

column1: W Dayton and N Broom Streets Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Officers were dispatched to check on an injured man found lying on a sidewalk Tuesday evening.

The man was near W. Dayton and N. Broom Streets around 8:45 p.m.

The victim told officers he was assaulted by someone he knew.

The suspect was located nearby.

Korey V. Johnson, 40, was arrested for substantial battery and bail jumping.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

column1: 1000 block of Williamson St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A delivery driver called police after seeing an injured man during a drop-off.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building along the 1000 block of William St. around 12:50 a.m. on Saturday.

They arrived to find blood smeared in the hallway of a common area.

Officers traced the blood to a unit where they found an injured 53-year-old male. The victim said he got into a verbal argument with an acquaintance and was injured by him when he tried to leave the apartment.

A 67-year-old man also had visible injuries and reported being punched by the suspect. He said he was doing laundry when he was randomly approached.

The suspect was walking out of the building when officers arrived. He resisted arrest and refused to identify himself.

David F. Atkinson, 48, was arrested for physical abuse of an elderly person, substantial battery, disorderly conduct, false imprisonment, resisting arrest and bail jumping. He was also cited for trespassing.
 
Officers also located several people hiding in common areas of the building.

A 53-year-old man was arrested for outstanding warrants and possession of drug paraphernalia. He was also cited for trespassing.

Another 53-year-old man and a 62-year-old man were also cited for trespassing.

The incident remains under investigation.

column1: 300 block W Gorham St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery that occurred downtown early Sunday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 300 block of W. Gorham St. around 12:25 a.m.

A man was walking with friends in this area when he was punched by the suspect. This caused the victim to fall to the ground and strike his head.

The victim was taken to the hospital for his injuries.
The suspect yelled racial slurs at one of the victim’s friends who intervened.

Caleb A. James, 21, of Illinois, was arrested for substantial battery, damage to property and disorderly conduct with a hate crime enhancer.

The Hate Crimes Task Force was notified about this incident.

column1: 100 block State Street Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery that occurred Wednesday evening along State Street.

Officers were dispatched to the 100 block around 8:15 p.m.

People reported seeing a group of juveniles jump and beat up an adult male. The victim is in his 60s.

The suspects were located by Wisconsin State Capitol Police on a bus a short time later.

Several teens involved were runaways. They were given restorative justice referrals and turned over to their guardians.  

A 13-year-old male was missing from Milwaukee and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.
 
The incident remains under investigation.

column1: Nakoosa Trail Safe Haven Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was taken to the hospital following a battery on the city's east side on Monday.

Officers were dispatched to the 4000 block of Nakoosa Trail around 4:40 p.m.

A 30-year-old man said he was punched at a nearby encampment and went to a shelter to call for help.

He was taken to the hospital for his injuries.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 2535 University Ave Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Officers were dispatched to a battery at the Blue Moon Bar and Grill.  We contacted a 71 year-old female customer that had been assaulted by another patron of the bar.

The victim had bloody scratches to her face and reported that while walking to use the restroom, she was attacked by a subject unknown to her.  That suspect, Isabel Wessell, grabbed the victim by the face, scratching her.  Several other witnesses in the business reported the same to the officer.

Wessel was contacted at the scene and placed under arrest.  She was lodged at the Dane County Jail for Physical Abuse of an Elder Person and Disorderly Conduct.
column12: Isabel C Wessell, 25 year old female

column1: 3700 block E Karstens Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
MPD's Hate Crime Task Force was notified about a dispute between neighbors on the city’s north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to an apartment building located along the 3700 block of E. Karstens Dr. shortly before 11 p.m. on Thursday.

A woman reported her neighbor had been yelling racial slurs for a week and believed they were directed at her family.

She tried talking to him, but he continued to yell the slurs.

The man then confronted the woman, and a 17-year-old male, in the hallway of their building. During this incident, the man slammed his door against the teen's hand.
 
The teen was taken to the hospital for his injuries.
 
The man refused to talk with police. There is probable cause to arrest him for this incident.  

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 400 block State St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after officers spotted an injured man on State Street.
 
A Central District Neighborhood Resource Officer noticed the man along the 400 block of State Street around 7:30 a.m. on Monday.

The officer directed the man to a nearby bench until EMS arrived. The 55-year-old man was taken to the hospital for his injuries. They are not considered life-threatening.
 
Officers are reviewing digital evidence.
 
No arrests have been made at this time.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 2200 Block S Park St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Madison police were dispatched to the 2200 block of S Park St reference a report of a substantial battery. Police contacted the victim, a clerk at the gas station, whom advised that two individuals had entered the store and began to take things without paying for them. The clerk then confronted the two individuals at which point one of the males physically attacked the victim. The victim sustained a broken nose and a facial laceration. The suspects fled prior to PD arrival.
 
This is an active investigation, Madison Police are attempting to locate and speak with the other party involved.

column1: 200 Block of State St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Madison police responded to the 200 block of State Street early Sunday morning after two workers at Paul’s Club were battered by an unruly patron.
 
The subject was reportedly trying to start fights with others in the business and when employees approached to ask the subject to leave, the subject turned his anger on staff.
 
Staff sustained minor injuries and the subject was arrested a short time later by police.
 
Michael Hommerding, 29, was arrested for 2 counts of simple battery.

column1: 5200 block Kevins Way Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Madison officers were dispatched on a “check person” call after a man ran away from home following an argument.

The man was not dressed for the weather and his family was concerned.

An MPD drone and K-9 unit were called in to help locate the man, who was last seen heading toward Heritage Heights Park on the city’s southeast side.

The MPD drone operator located the man lying in the snow and directed officers to his whereabouts.

The man was treated by EMS for cold exposure.

column1: N Park St and Regent St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
MPD and MFD Officers are responding to call in progress at this intersection.  Traffic is shut down.  We are asking the public to please avoid the area at this time.  An update will be coming.





This mental health situation has safely resolved and the subject is receiving help and treatment.  Traffic is open in all directions.  Thank you.

column1: 1100 block Morraine View Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after two young children were found wandering around an apartment complex on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1100 block of Morraine View Dr. around 7:20 p.m. on Thursday.

The children were not dressed appropriately for the weather. They were able to help officers find their apartment.

No adults were home.

Officers noticed feces, urine, soiled diapers and trash spread across the unit’s floor. The children also did not have easy access to food or water.

Child Protective Services responded and took custody of the children.

A 26-year-old woman returned home several hours later. She was arrested for child neglect.
 
The dog was turned over to the humane society.

column1: State Street and East Campus Mall Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man, actively trying to fight with people near the tent encampment on the UW-Madison campus, was arrested Wednesday night.

Officers were dispatched to the area of East Campus Mall and State Street around 9:10 p.m. for a report of a man threatening others.

As they attempted to make contact with the man he was uncooperative, refused to identify himself and ran into the middle of the encampment. 

The man resisted arrest and a crowd gathered around him as he was taken into custody.

Two people reported the suspect made threats to kill another individual prior to police arrival. 

Elijah M. Lytle, 20, was arrested for disorderly conduct and resisting arrest. He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

No injuries were reported.

column1: WB Beltline at John Nolen Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Officers helped a woman who was walking along the Beltline on Monday afternoon.

Officers responded to the west bound Beltline at John Nolen Dr. around 3:20 pm.

Officers consulted with Journey Mental Health.

The woman was taken to a local hospital for additional help.

column1: 4800 block of Hayes Rd Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A 4-year-old child was found wandering around the road in the middle of the night.

Officers were dispatched to the 4800 block of Hayes Rd. around 2:50 a.m. on Tuesday.

After two hours of extensive search efforts, officers were able to re-unite the child with their mother.

The child has a history of escaping and wandering the area.

Child Protective Services was notified of this incident.

column1: 216 State Street Madison Wisconsin
column8:
On June 21, 2024, officers responded to the 200 block of State Street in response to reports of a male subject acting erratically and running after women who were passing through the area.  The subject was also observed running at cars that drove by as if he were trying to collide with them.  One woman who escaped from the male subject flagged down a nearby officer, who in turn requested backup and attempted to confront the male subject.  

The male subject fled when the first officer approached him, but was apprehended by another officer coming into the area.  Three officers attempted to maintain control of the subject as he fought with them and resisted their attempts to place him in handcuffs.  Officers made multiple attempts to deploy Electronic Control Devices to subdue the subject as he fought them and disregarded their commands, but the male subject was able to free himself and again fled on foot.  

As more officers came into the area to help, the subject was cornered and additional officers attempted to wrestle him into custody.  Further deployments of Electronic Control Devices were used and a total of seven officers were required to get the man into restraints.  

Four officers were treated at a local hospital for minor injuries consisting of abrasions, bruises and a facial laceration.  Even after chemical sedation at the hospital, the suspect was resistive and required extra officers to assist with the transport.  

The subject, now identified as 30 year old Tyrone Underwood, has been booked into the Dane County Jail and is facing numerous charges including Resisting Causing Injury and Disorderly Conduct.  It has now been discovered that Underwood was also being sought by officers in another district for charges on an unrelated matter, and as he is currently out on bail for another recent case, he is also facing Bail Jumping charges.  

Officers believe Underwood was under the influence of illegal drugs, which likely contributed to his erratic behavior and allowed him to resist the efforts of numerous officers to take him into custody.

column1: 100 block N Thompson Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8: MPD and MFD were dispatched to a call of a fully-engulfed pop-up camper parked on the street.  MFD exinguished the fire.  No loss of life.  The street was shut down briefly while the area was made safe.  MFD and MPD Arson Investigators will be investigating.

column1: 5000 block American Pkwy Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was given a municipal citation on Tuesday for accidentally discharging his firearm.

The 21-year-old man called to report the incident shortly before 3 p.m. on Tuesday.

He was cleaning the firearm in his apartment, located along the 5000 block of American Pkwy, when it discharged.

The bullet shattered the man’s glass door and entered the outside courtyard.

No one was injured during this incident.

The man has a valid concealed carry license.

Officers spoke to him about safety measures to follow when cleaning a firearm. 

He was issued a citation regarding the accidental discharge.

column1: 2000 Tennyson Lane Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Someone called 911 late Sunday night after seeing three juveniles attempting to break into vehicles parked on the north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 2000 block of Tennyson Lane around 11 p.m. on Saturday.

The trio initially ran from responding officers but were quickly taken into custody.

Officers also found a realistic-looking facsimile firearm in the snow.

One vehicle had a smashed-out window.

Those involved are a 12-year-old male, an 11-year-old male and a 15-year-old male.

They were released to their parents and given referrals to our Restorative Justice program for criminal damage to property.

column1: 400 block W Washington Ave Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was cited after accidentally discharged his firearm while cleaning it. 

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building located along the 400 block of W. Washington Ave. shortly before 7 p.m. on Friday. 

A round hit a sink and went into a cabinet behind it. A photo of the damaged sink is attached to this report.

No injuries were reported.

The 23-year-old man had a valid concealed carry license. He was cited for discharging a firearm.

column1: 600 block Langdon St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after several eggs were launched at the UW Hillel Foundation on Tuesday night.

Hillel Foundation staff self-reported the incident to the Madison Police Department on Wednesday morning.
 
The eggs hit the higher floors of the building.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence. Hillel security cameras show the eggs hitting the building around 9:20 p.m. Tuesday.

The building was not damaged but staff estimate it will cost several thousands of dollars to have cleaned. 

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The Hate Crimes Task Force has been made aware of this incident.

Anyone with information is asked to conact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously and may be eligible for a reward. Funds can also be collected anonymously. 

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: Kessel Ct Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A property manager called police after noticing what appeared to be bullet holes in an apartment building.

Officers were dispatched to Kessel Ct. around 4:10 p.m. on Thursday.

The front of a building had some damage. A projective was also discovered in the wall of one unit.

No injuries were reported.

There have been no reports of shots fired in this area in recent days.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: Mineral Point Rd. at S. Rosa Rd. Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after a bus shelter was damaged in March.

Officers responded to the shelter located on Mineral Point Road at S. Rosa Rd. around 2:30 p.m. on March 25.

Construction crews arrived to work that day to find the damage. They were last in the area on March 21, when no damage was observed.

Several glass panes were shattered by a projectile the size of a BB. Photos of the damage are attached to this release.

No injuries were reported. No arrests have been made at this time.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

column1: Hollywood Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was cited for accidentally firing a gun Thursday morning.
 
Officers were dispatched to Hollywood Dr. at 9:10 a.m.

The 47-year-old man's vehicle was damaged during the incident.

He was educated on safe handling of firearms.

He was cited for discharging a firearm and released.

column1: 500 block of Mifflin Street Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after a car was flipped over and damaged during the Mifflin Street Block Party.
 
More than 150 officers were assigned to the event, which typically draws thousands of people to the 400 and 500 blocks of Mifflin Street each year.

Many of these people attended house parties and were gathered in the backyards (private properties) of homes.
 
Around 2:40 p.m. on April 27, officers were forced to clear the backyards along the 500 block of Mifflin after a people flipped over a vehicle. No one was injured when this occurred. No arrests have been made.
 
We are making positive progress in identifying those involved. Detectives are reviewing videos showing the damage as it occurred. Still images from some of those videos are attached to this release. If you recognize anyone please contact Detective Brown at 608-219-4491.

The Madison Police Department will give consideration to those who come forward and take responsibility for their actions by giving them an order-in court date. Those identified, who do not come forward, will be arrested and taken to jail.
 
Officers with the Madison Police Department went door to door the week leading up to the block party. They encouraged residents to remove cars from the area, lock up valuables and talked about some of the city ordinances they could enforce during the block party. A community meeting was also held for residents and property owners on April 18.
 
The Mifflin Street Block Party is not a sanctioned event. This was the most attended block party since the pandemic.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 200 block W Beltline Highway Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after 27 buses were damaged with graffiti.
 
An employee arrived to the First Student bus department located along the 200 block of W. Beltline Highway on Thursday.
 
Someone used black spray paint on the buses sometime between Wednesday night and Thursday morning.  
 
Much of the graffiti made statements such as “Free Palestine" and "Stop the War." 
 
Employees estimate around several thousand dollars of damage was done. Photos of the damaged buses are attached to this release.
 
No arrests have been made.
 
Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 2070 Helena St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Around 11:30PM on June 20, 2024, officers responded to 2070 Helena Street, the headquarters of Schoeps Ice Cream, in reference to a complaint of vandals actively spray-painting the exterior of the building. 

The two suspects fled, but one was apprehended and in her possession were several additional spray cans, paint markers, and other items associated with vandalism.  

The suspect was found to be a Belgian citizen and told officers she was planning to fly home at the end of the week.  She was booked into the Dane County Jail on charges of Criminal Damage to Property.  

Madison Police officers have reported seeing similar graffiti in other areas of the city, so it is believed that tonight’s suspects are responsible for multiple acts of vandalism.

column1: Iota Ct Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department continues to investigate after a woman was rescued from Lake Mendota.
 
Officers responded to Iota Ct. around 4:25 a.m. on Friday. They arrived to find a woman’s body in the water and immediately called for help from the Madison Fire Department’s Lake Rescue team. The woman was taken to the hospital and later pronounced dead.
 
At this time, detectives are working to determine how the woman entered the water. Nothing suspicious was found at the scene.
 
Detectives are talking to those who live nearby and collecting video from the area.

The scammer used caller ID spoofing and made it appear as if he was actually calling from a Milwaukee Police Department phone line.

column1: 211 S Carroll St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is experiencing an increase in fraudulent cases where scammers are targeting retirement accounts. In reviewing reports on this incident, it sounds like victims are being greeted with a popup in their banking software telling them that a transfer of funds has been validated to a possible illicit activity, accusing the victim of engaging in illegal activity. The pop-up also has a phone number to call.
 
Once the number has been called, victims report being transferred to other phone lines or being asked to wait on calls. After being on the phone, they are asked to drain money from their accounts in order to transfer it to another individual so that the initial fraud could be investigated. Once all the money from their account is drained out, victims are being encouraged to purchase gold and to transfer that money.
 
The Madison Police Department is aware of these cases and is actively investigating them. To keep your accounts safe, the Madison Police Department recommends:
 
Be cautious of any entity asking you to quickly transfer funds over the phone.
If you see suspicious activity on your accounts, report it to your banking entity.
Remember that law enforcement will not ask for funds in exchange for us to investigate a crime or alleged fraud.
Take time to conduct internet searches of numbers given by these pop ups to see if they are legitimate.
If someone is claiming you transferred funds from your account, take the time to independently verify if this occurred (logging onto your bank account or contacting your local branch).

Another resource to consider is the Internet Crime Complaint Center, www.ic3.gov

Increased Traffic Enforcement in February


This month, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, has been and will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's seatbelt and alcohol laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 

The goal of these extra patrols is not just to arrest drivers.  The mission is to enhance public safety and prevent needless tragedies by discouraging people from making dangerous decisions and engaging in unsafe behaviors while driving.  Someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin and thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.

The Madison Police Department needs your help to make our roads safer.  Please, put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.

The Madison Police Department Increasing Traffic Enforcement in 2024


In 2024, the Madison Police Department will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's bicycle and pedestrian laws.  In addition, MPD will continue to work with the Dane County Sheriff’s Officer to enforce seatbelt, alcohol, and speed laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 
  • On average, every day, twenty pedestrians are killed by a moving vehicle in the United States. 
  • Pedestrian deaths have been climbing since 2010 - primarily due to motorists who drive recklessly and aggressively, speed and are distracted.

Click It or Ticket Enforcement Campaign

?The Madison Police Department will be joining law enforcement agencies across Wisconsin and the United States in stepping up the enforcement of seatbelt laws. The high-visibility Click It or Ticket seatbelt campaign, which coincides with the beginning of the busy summer travel season, runs from May 20 through June 2, 2024.
 
The purpose of the campaign is to remind motorists about the importance of seatbelt use, enforce the life-saving habit of wearing a seatbelt, and reduce the number of fatalities that occur when drivers and passengers fail to buckle up.  Wisconsin’s primary seatbelt law allows law enforcement to stop and cite motorists for failing to wear a seatbelt. Drivers can also be cited for every unbuckled passenger in their vehicle.

Wearing your seatbelt is one of the easiest and most effective steps you can take to survive a crash.  If you know a friend or a family member who does not buckle up when they drive, please ask them to consider changing their habits. Help us spread this lifesaving message before one more friend or family member is killed as a result of this senseless inaction. Seat belts save lives, and everyone — front seat and back, child and adult — needs to remember to buckle up.

The Madison Police Department and the Wisconsin Department of Transportation are asking for your help with making our roads safer and achieving zero travel-related deaths in Wisconsin. 

Please buckle up.  Every trip.  Every time.

column1: 89 E Towne Way Madison Wisconsin
column8:
On June 23, 2024, Madison Police conducted an enforcement operation in the area of the East Towne Mall in response to an unsanctioned racing-related event that was scheduled to take place there.  The event, referred to as “Madison Takeover 2024,” was slated to take place after the mall closed, with invitations circulating on social media.  

Street racing and the resulting reckless driving behavior has been a top concern for the Madison Police Department as it has been associated with a number of fatalities on local roadways.  The racing activity has also been linked to disturbances, drug use, and significant property damage.  East Towne Mall management has reported hundreds of thousands of dollars in property damage in the last few months, mainly to paved surfaces, as a result of car racing and burnouts on the premises.  

During tonight’s enforcement operation, members of the Community Policing Team, along with other officers, issued over 80 citations in the East Towne Mall and E. Washington Ave corridor.  Most of the citations were for trespassing, but citations were also issued for speeding and reckless driving as well.

Three shell casings were recovered in the area of Esther Court and McCann Rd.

No injuries were reportd.

No property damage was reported.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 300 W Gorham St Madison Wisconsin
1000 block Moorland Rd Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after shots were fired at a south side home on Saturday night.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 1000 block of Moorland Road around 9:20 p.m. on Saturday.
 
Dispatch received a report that an intoxicated man was attending a family gathering and asked to leave upon becoming belligerent. The man later returned and fire a round at the house.

Several children and adults were inside the home when this incident occurred. None of them were physically injured.

The suspect was in a white SUV when officers arrived at the scene. He nearly hit responding officers as he sped away from the area.
 
The suspect did not pull over for officers in front of the home and continued westbound down Moorland Road. He was eventually taken into custody near Moorland and Raywood Roads. His vehicle was running and facing oncoming traffic.

The suspect was asked by multiple officers to leave the vehicle, but he ignored their commands, and a canine was used. Two guns were found inside his vehicle.
 
The suspect was taken to the hospital before going to jail.
 
Sherman M. Street, 49, was arrested for first-degree recklessly endangering safety, 3rd-offfense OWI, eluding, carrying a concealed weapon, resisting, knowingly fleeing an officer and battery.
 
One of the officers responding to the scene was involved in a crash. That officer was treated and released at the hospital for their injuries.

The driver of the other vehicle involved was treated at the scene for their injuries.
 
Traffic was shut down in the area as a result of the traffic stop and crash.

The Dane County Sheriff’s Office is handling the crash portion of this investigation.

The incident remains an open and active investigation.

column1: Waunona Woods Ct Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after damage, consistent with bullet holes, was found inside an apartment.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment on Waunona Woods Ct. around 12:20 p.m. on April 5.
 
A woman told police she believed the damage was caused in March. An investigator responded to document the damage. No bullets or shell casings were located.

No injuries were reported.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 1300 block S Park St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is looking to identify a woman who cut another shopper at a grocery store.

Officers were dispatched to the Pick n’ Save on S. Park Street around 4:40 p.m. on Sunday.

They arrived to find a woman bleeding from the face. The suspect made comments about the victim taking too long in the checkout line.

The two got into an argument and the suspect pulled out what was believed to be a knife and swung it at the woman’s face in front of a child.
 
The woman was taken to the hospital for her injuries.
 
Photos of the suspect have been attached to this release. A photo of the van she left the store in is also attached.
 
If you can identify the suspect or have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, information may be shared with Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. People contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash for tips that lead to an arrest.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: Moorland Rd and Manor Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Multiple people reported hearing shots being fire on the city's south side early Friday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Moorland Rd. and Manor Dr. around 2:50 a.m.

Callers reported hearing multiple shots and vehicles speeding away.

Officers did an extensive search of the area. They did not find any injured people or property damage. There were also no other signs of a shooting.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: Mendota Elementary School Madison Wisconsin
column8:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after shots were fired near a school over the weekend.

Officers were dispatched to Mendota Elementary School, located along the 400 block of School Road, shortly before 4 p.m. on Saturday.

Witnesses reported seeing two men involved in the incident. Both ran away from the school following the gunshots.

Officers located multiple shell casings in the north alley driveway of the school.

No injuries were reported. 

Offices cleared school grounds and areas nearby and found no signs of property damage.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and can be eligible for a monetary reward.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 800 block Atlas Court Madison Wisconsin
column8:
More than twenty shell casings were recovered after shots were fired early Sunday morning on the east side.

Officers were dispatched to a nightclub located along the 800 block of Atlas Ave. around 1:15 a.m.

No injuries were reported.

Shell casings were found in the road on Atlas Ave. and alongside the road on Cottage Grove Rd.

No property damage was noticed.

No arrests have been made at this time. 

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously. Information leading to an arrest may be eligible for a monetary reward.

The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 700 block Braxton Place Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a report of a victim with a stab wound at Meriter Hospital in the early morning hours of 4/21/24.  The crime is believed to have occurred at or near the 700 block of Braxton Place.  The victim is being treated and is in stable condition.  The investigation is on-going.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

column1: 2500 block of Monterey Drive, Madison, WI Madison Wisconsin
column8:
On April 29, 2024 at 9:10pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a Disturbance followed by Weapons Offense-Shots Fired in the hallway of an apartment building located in the 2500 block of Monterey Drive. Upon arrival, officers located evidence indicating there was a recent shooting and shortly thereafter were dispatched to an address in the East Police District in order to contact the victim of this crime.

During the course of the investigation, it was determined that the suspects fled into a different apartment (within the same building) and with the help of additional on duty resources, police made entry into that apartment and apprehended two individuals. Additional evidence was located inside the apartment and the firearm believed to have been used in commission of this crime was recovered. Detectives from the Violent Crime Unit (VCU) are leading the investigation which remains active and ongoing.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

column1: Madison Yards Way Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was cleaning his gun when it accidentally discharged and sent a bullet into his neighbor’s apartment.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 4700 block of Madison Yards Way around 9:30 p.m. on Wednesday.
 
The stray bullet damaged the neighbor’s freezer. No one was injured during the incident. The man went to check on his neighbor and they called police.
 
The man was cooperative with officers. His firearm was seized. He was cited for discharging a firearm.

column1: 100 block Edna Ct Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A Madison man was arrested following a stabbing on the east side this weekend.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 100 block of Edna Ct. around 9:50 p.m. on Friday.

They arrived and immediately began providing medical help to the victim until he was taken to the hospital. His injuries were not considered life-threatening.
 
The victim and suspect are known to one another. They were yelling at one another before the argument turned physical.
 
The suspect left the area before police arrived. Officers connected with him at a home along the 2800 block of Holborn Circle around 9:25 a.m. on Saturday.
 
He was taken into custody without incident.

James A. Edwards, 37, of Madison, was arrested for 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety and disorderly conduct while armed.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 5700 block Hammersley Rd Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Multiple people called to report hearing gunshots Sunday night on the city’s west side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 5700 block of Hammersley Road around 9:05 p.m.
 
No injuries were reported.
 
Officers searched the area and could not find any casings or property damage.
 
Officers learned there were several Cinco De mayo parties in the area with fireworks.

This remains under investigation.

column1: 700 Pflaum Road Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A student was arrested Tuesday afternoon after a gun was found in his backpack at La Follette High School.

Officers were already at the school investigating an armed robbery when they were approached by a staff member. This staff member was told a student had a gun in their backpack and asked police for help searching the bag. The student was in a different room, separated from his bag, when officers were approached.

A gun, filled magazines, unfired bullets, a scale and empty bag of cannabis flower were found inside.

The student involved lunged toward the gun as police were taking him into custody.

Kyshawn M. Bankston, 18, was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon, possessing a firearm on school property and resisting arrest.

He was booked into the Dane County Jail without further incident.

The gun involved was not stolen.
Detectives are working to determine if this weapon was the same gun involved in the armed robbery incident.

This remains an open and active investigation.

column1: 200 Block N Thompson Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8: Madison Police recieved a call of multiple shots being fired and vehicles fleeing near the 200 block of North Thompson Drive. Officers responded and located several fired casings. No injured persons or damaged property were located.

column1: 1818 Portage Road Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Shortly before 09:30PM on May 12, officers were dispatched to 1818 Portage Road, the area of Reindahl Park, for reports of multiple gunshots.  Officers responded to the park to find a male who had apparently been struck by gunfire, and the officers rendered life-saving aid while awaiting the arrival of emergency medical services.  The victim was transported to an area hospital where he continued to receive medical treatment for his critical injuries. 
 
In addition to attending to the wounded victim, initial responding officers detained two people of interest who were believed to have been involved in the incident.  A gathering was taking place at Reindahl Park at the time of the weapons offense, and it does not appear that the victim was randomly targeted.  The Violent Crime Unit responded to assist officers in the handling of the investigation, which is still active at this time. 

Lt. Caleb Johnson

column1: 200 block S Gammon Rd Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A 16-year-old student was arrested for bringing a BB gun to school.

Officers were dispatched to Memorial High School around 12:10 p.m. on Thursday. 

The student had a warrant and he was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

column1: 500 block of Northport Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
While driving in the 500 block of Northport Dr, a man was shot at several times. He was not injured, but his vehicle was hit.

The man fled in his vehicle and ended up crashing nearby. He then ran to a close apartment complex where police contacted him. The man said he did not know who or why anyone was shooting at him.

MPD’s Violent Crime Unit is assigned to the case and are working on getting more evidence.

column1: 1200 block of Meadow Sweet Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A couple was cleaning their home office when they located a hole in their window. Officers determined the hole to be from a bullet and the bullet was located outside of the home. No one was in the office at the time and the homeowners reported that they did not hear or see anything.

They also reported that the same area of their home had been struck several years ago. Officers reported that the backyard of the home is next to the woods of Elver Park where there is known hunting.

column1: 4501 Verona Road Madison Wisconsin
column8: Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a weapons offense in progress that originated in the 4500 block of Verona Road.  A caller reported that a vehicle occupied with three men had brandished firearms and verbally threatened their life.  Officers found the suspect vehicle and attempted to stop it, but the vehicle fled eastbound on Highway 12 to the Interstate.  Multiple jurisdictions helped in getting the vehicle stopped on High Crossing Blvd and the occupants were detained.  Multiple firearms were found in the vehicle and charges on the suspects are pending.  The investigation is ongoing.

column1: 400 Block of W Johnson Street Madison Wisconsin
column8: At approximately 12:44AM Madison Police officers were dispatched to a disturbance at an apartment complex in the 400 block of W. Johnson Street.  When officers arrived in the area, they located a person suffering from an apparent gunshot wound and found indications that others might be in need of assistance as well.  Officers searched the surrounding area and entered the apartment building, locating multiple additional injured persons and providing medical treatment.  The scene was stabilized and the injured were transported to local hospitals for further care.  At this point, none of the injuries are believed to be life-threatening.  This appears to be a targeted incident and the suspect is still at large.  The Violent Crime Unit is leading this ongoing investigation.

column1: Trafalger Place  Andrew Way Madison Wisconsin
3300 block of Milwaukee St Madison Wisconsin
column8:
A man was taken to the hospital after accidentally shooting himself while cleaning his gun.

Officers were dispatched to the 3300 block of Milwaukee Street around 3:30 p.m. on Tuesday.

Officers began providing medical aid to the 21-year-old man. He was conscious and alert when he was taken to the hospital.

The man was issued a municipal citation for discharging a firearm in city limits.

column1: 200 Block Cardinal Lane Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Madison police received a call in the 200 block of Cardinal Lane regarding two men fighting with knives. Upon arrival, police encounter two males with knives. MPD starts issuing commands to the men at which point one male drops his knife and the other one flees.
 
The male whom remained on scene had laceration marks on his hand. He reports that he was approached by the other party while sitting in his vehicle at which point the other party began to stab him. The victim tried to defend himself by arming himself with a pipe and eventually was able to get the suspect’s knife away from him. MPD did recover a knife on scene.
 
Suspect unknown at this time. Incident under investigation.

column1: 1100 block Morraine View Dr Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Officers responded to the 1100 block of Morraine View Dr on the city’s West side Tuesday afternoon for a domestic disturbance involving a knife.
 
Initial information was that the victim and her children were unable to leave the apartment due to the suspect possessing a knife and not allowing them to leave.
 
As officers arrived, the victim and children were able to leave and meet officers. The victim suffered minor injuries and there were no physical injures to the children.
 
Aaron Mixon, 23, was arrested for domestic battery, disorderly conduct and felony bail jumping.

column1: 50 block Northridge Terrace Madison Wisconsin
column8:
Madison Officer’s responded to the 50 block of Northridge Terrace after a caller reported hearing about 15 shots fired and arguing.
 
Officers responded to the area and located 6 shell casings and 1 unfired bullet near a parking lot. Two vehicles were struck by gunfire and were unoccupied. One of the vehicles was also a stolen auto.
 
No reports of injuries at this time. Investigation is ongoing.
